1.content:
Cindy was 18 years old, with long curly flaming red hair and green eyes. She had a decent figure and C-sized breasts. She attended a university that was relatively unknown (isn't that always the way?)
One fine Tuesday afternoon she was wandering through campus when she spotted a flyer that caught her eye.
"WANTED:
Test subject for experiment
Will Pay $10,000
Apply to Professor Eomot in Lab A"
"Hmm," she thought. I could use $10,000..."
She grabbed the flyer and went to Lab A.

Professor Eomot was a tall, greying man with glasses. "Ah, a test subject. Excellent. My stereotypically busty assistant will give you some forms to sign, and we'll strap you in."
"Umm, what are you testing?" Cindy asked nervously.
"A teleportation device." The assistant handed Cindy the forms and she scribbled her name on the bottom.
"Excellent. Now, have a seat," Eomot said, gesturing to an odd-looking chair, one of a set of two. Cindy sat down and the assistant did up a bewildering array of straps and buckles. "OK. Now. As soon as the experiment is over, you shall recieve your $10,000. Are you ready?"
Cindy nodded.
"Good." He pulled a lever on the wall, the chair hummed, and Cindy jumped instantly to the other in a burst of light.
1.title: The Experiment

11.content:
Cindy slowly regained consciousness, feeling like she'd recieved a good solid kick in the head. "Unnnnnh..." she moaned as her eyes regained focus. Eomot and his assistant stared down at her. They were huge! Cindy scrabbled to her feet. "What... what happened?" She gasped. "I'm naked!" She covered her chest with her arm and bent over.
"Um. There was a bit of a mishap. A fly landed on this chair just as I activated it, and...." He trailed off and held up a mirror in front of her.
Cindy looked at herself. She looked normal.... wait, there were two giant wings coming out of her back!
"Your DNA got scrambled with the fly's. As a result, you now have wings and the fly is human-sized," Eomot said as his assistant attacked the fly with a baseball bat.
"What about my clothes?" Cindy shrieked.
"Evidently, the machine only works on living tissue. Look, I am sorry, but as soon as we can return you to normal size we will, and you shall recieve $20,000 afterwards as compensation. In the meanwhile, we would be interested in studying your.... condition, so will you hop in this jar?" he said.
Cindy took a deep breath and replied...
11.title: The Mishap

choices: The Giant fly knocks the jar out of the doctor's hands.
111.content:
"Ok I guess." Cindy replied as she carefully stepped towards the large lid of the jar that was being held near her, making sure to cover he private areas as her tiny fly sized form stepped inside the large cavernous jar. The doctor moved the jar causing her to lose balance and plummet down to the bottom. The jar was placed on a table and Cindy heard a loud scraping sound of metal on glass. She looked up and saw a lid with holes being put on the top. The doctor then held the jar in front of his face to examine the fly sized winged girl.

"It is amazing, to think you have become nothing more than a tiny insect girl now, don't worry though..." The doctor began to say.
111.title: "Ok."

choices: Too bad Cindy... Cindy enters the Habitat
This ain't so bad... The Human Insect Kingdom
1112.content:
"We will find a way to change you back once the experiment is over." The doctor laughed as he looked down at the helpless girl.

"What do you mean, what experiment!" Cindy shouted frantically in her squelchy miniature voice concerned by the doctor's comments.

"You see, the fly landing on the teleportation device was no accident my dear girl. I have been collecting quite an environment of... human insects for a long time now, you are my newest edition, and I must say, of them all I'm amazed by how much of your human form you have retained." The doctor explained as he walked out of the lab area. Behind him his assistant was fighting with the giant fly but was gaining the upper hard, bashing the monster with a large sledge hammer.

"What, you mean you're not going to change me back! Get me out of here, Help!" Cindy screamed in terror as she frantically beat on the sides of the jar prison. She fluttered her new wings and began to fly around the jar but soon lost control and smashed into the lid hard. She fell back to the bottom of the jar, the doctor laughing at the entire time as he watched her pathetic attempts to escape. She realized it was hopeless and sat dejectedly at the bottom of the jar, tears welling up in her eyes as she feared her life as a human was over.

"You'll want to get better with those if you want to survive." The doctor stated after his laughing fit had died down.

"Survive, what do you mean, you're not going to kill me are you?" Cindy replied in shock at the doctor's statement.

"I won't, but some of my other experiments inside the habitat have a bit more animal instinct and desire than you, and well, spider's tend to enjoy the occasional fly every now and then." The doctor laughed sinisterly as he placed the jar atop a large empty fish tank that was filled with a habitat. The fish tank was massive, about the size of a large van, with small trees, flowers, plants, and a deep soil surface; and even a small pond near the center. The lid was face down atop the large habitat and Cindy tried to veer out through the holes into this terrible jungle that she would soon become a part of. Suddenly a machine began to open the jar as a tube slid around to ensure that Cindy couldn't escape...
1112.title: What a mad scientist, Help!

choices: Snap... the leaf snaps and Cindy falls to the ground
11122.content:
Cindy tried to flutter her wings as she fell from the tube and entered the inside of the massive fish tank-insect habitat. She was still not used to having wings, or being the size of a fly as she fell and hit a few gigantic leaves, eventually managing to stop herself atop of one. She couldn't believe how small she was now, the leaf's surface was the size of a parking small parking lot. She looked around the inside of the habitat, small trees and rotting logs were located all around. She could hear movement all around, the buzzing of wings and the crunching of rotting wood, but was unable to see anything from the center of the giant leaf. She got up and walked across the leaf until she was able to peer over the side.

Down below she saw a half eaten hamburger that was being swarmed by what appeared to be ants. As she looked closer she could see some human features on the ants below gathering up pieces of the hamburger. Some had human legs or heads and varied in color between the basic red and black ant colors, while some had human colored skin tones on their insect bodies.

'How could he do this to so many people, there must be over fifty of them down there.' Cindy was shocked to see so many other people transformed by this mad scientist into insects. She continued to watch when out of the corner of her eye she saw two larger insects moving behind a few small branches. These insects were larger than the ants but also had human features. She watched in horror as the two large ants rushed out from the branches to attack the ants. Tiny screams were heard as the ants were ripped to shreds and devoured by the two monstrous insect men who had attacked. The ants scattered but many of them were killed.

Cindy was shocked and appalled, tears welled in her eyes as she saw the tiny dead ants being devoured by the larger insects. Just then she heard a noise...
11122.title: Too bad Cindy... Cindy enters the Habitat

choices: was seriously injured, he's in the hospital.
was arrested, for trying dangerous experiments
1113.content:
I promise you that we'll find a way to revert this ." Eomot compromises, after all, if he resolves this situation, not only he would create the first teleportation device, but, a machine with infinite possibilities for DNA experimentation.

"Thanks, professor, it is a relief hearing that." Cindy replies.

"Professor, look out!!" his assistant warns, the human-sized fly attacks him with its legs, throwing the jar outside of a window, the last scene that Cindy observes it's the fly over Eomot. The jar rolls over until it hits a light pole, smashing it into tiny pieces.

Cindy gets up, feeling dizzy from the ride and confused about her surroundings, "Stupid fly, where am I?, if only I had a way to see more." she then remembers about her wings, "Let's try these things." jumping as high as she can, Cindy wings instinctively react and she starts to fly, "This is amazing, I can fly!!" she goes higher to see where she was, "Looks that I'm still on campus, you two turned out to be useful." she compliments her new additions, "Maybe this isn't so bad." she descends, landing in a coin on the floor, "Oh, right, I'm small, I need to go back with the professor."

With her new ability, Cindy returns to Laboratory A, only to find Eomot's assistant trying to clean. "Excuse me." the tiny girl says, "Who said that?, wait, Cindy, thank goodness, you are okay." she replies, "Yes, I'm fine, and where's the fly and the professor?" she asks, "Well. the fly is locked in an old warehouse, we had to call some security guards to take it, probably it didn't like the changes." she responds, "And I'm sorry, but, the professor....
1113.title: The Giant fly knocks the jar out of the doctor&...

choices: with you, as long as I don't become a guinea pig."
my parents, their house it's outside of the campus."
11131.content:
"And all of that happened in just a couple of minutes!?" a surprised Cindy asks, forgetting her current state.

"Uh, actually, Cindy, it passed approximately 15 minutes since you got thrown in the jar." the assistant replies, feeling more relieved that things didn't get worse.

"I guess I wasn't as fast as I thought." she flies around to calm down."Interesting, you managed to use yours wings, that's quite a breakthrough." Eomot's assistant comments, "Thanks, otherwise, I wouldn't catch up with you." the small girl responds, "Let's forget about these and let's talk, do you think you could bring me back?", "I don't know how to say this, Cindy..." she sighs, "Follow me" she finishes.

Turning all the laboratory lights on, the assistant shows to Cindy the teleportation device, or at least, what was left of it, "Before attacking us, the fly destroyed it.", "But, it can be fixed, right?" she starts to get anxious, "Of course, but, professor Eomot is the only person who knows where the blueprints are, and with this you can imagine about his health status." with those words, Cindy couldn't hold herself and tears started to flow through her cheeks, she only wanted some money and ended up as a fly.

"Look, Cindy, Professor Eomot gave you his word, and I'm giving you mine. We will fix this, just try to wait for now.", "And how I'm supposed to do it!?" Cindy demands, "I'm naked and small as a fly, and I still have classes." she crosses her arms, "I got it, you signed all the forms, this might get you an excuse for not attending classes, what I still don't know is where are you going to stay in the meantime, by the way, I'm Janet Johnson, if you need anything.", "It's nice to meet you, I think I could stay with.....
11131.title: was seriously injured, he's in the hospital."

choices: A new day as a fly.
111312.content:
"So you don't stay in one of the dormitories?" Janet wonders.

"Nah, we always lived near the university, that's one of the reasons why I chose to study here." Cindy replies, getting used to her new form.

"Good, explaining this to a roommate would be pretty awkward." the assistant shrugs, "Let me come with you, this might be difficult for your parents."

"And for my little brother, well, not so little now." she replies, flying next to Janet's head, "Is weird, you know, if I wasn't tiny, this could be amazing."

"Still is, though." Janet responds, as both of them go towards Cindy's house.

With the campus almost empty because it was night already, Janet walks with Cindy by her side, talking about her life before the incident, the two woman laugh for their stories. Knocking at the door, a woman in her middle 40's opens, "Excuse me, are you Cindy Carter's mother?" Janet asks,

"Yes, why do you ask?"

"Can I please come in? I need to tell you something about your daughter with your family, apparently." she replies, meanwhile, Cindy was hiding in Janet's neck.

After calling everyone, Cindy's parents and her 10 year-old brother gather in the living room to hear the assistant.

"Let me introduce myself, I'm Janet Johnson, I work as an lab assistant in Cindy's university, I'm here to tell you that she proposed herself to test a teleportation device." she says, "By the way, where is she?" Cindy's mother asks, "That's why I'm here, the thing is, a problem occurred during testing.", she sees everybody nervous, "Don't worry, she is okay , but, she changed a little." she finishes.

"And I repeat, where is she?", Janet closes her eyes, "Cindy, you can get out now." a tiny figure flies behind Janet's head and lands on the table.

"Hi, everybody." Cindy says, covering her privates from her family.

"Cool, Cindy is small." her brother extends his hand towards her, but, Janet blocks it.

"She's not a toy, kid, she's still your sister." she then explains the whole story, Cindy's mother fainted and her father was amazed about the situation.

"At last, I need to tell you something, this includes you, Cindy, you can't tell anybody about this, no doctors or people from the university, if they know about her. She will end up as a test subject for other experiments."
111312.title: my parents, their house it's outside of the...

choices: Everyody leaves and Cindy stays to check the house.
David grabs Cindy and takes her to school.
1113121.content:
In the morning, Cindy sleeps peacefully, imagining that her problems were just a bad dream.

"HEY, TINKERBELL, breakfast is ready, get up." her setting shakes causing a fall from her bed, a reminder that all the events from yesterday were real, Cindy groans and waits for her brother to leave the room, well, the lunch box located in her room.

She peeks around and there are no signs of him, she quickly flies in the direction of the living room, however, she gets hit by a fly swatter.

"Bulls eye." her brother celebrates, she lands on some dirty clothes

"How many times I need to tell you this, David, stop bothering your sister!" their father scolds him, "And hurry up, you have school today, Cindy, are you okay?".
.
"Yeah, I think so, good to know David sees the bright side." she cleans some tears formed in her eyes.

With everybody on the table, breakfast begins, meanwhile, Cindy tries to figure out how is she going to eat the waffles on her plate because it's three times bigger than her, "Sorry honey, let me help you." her mother says, cutting some tiny pieces for her, "Thanks, mom.", "You're welcome, so, what are we going to do?, I mean, she can't stay like that forever.".

"Right, you fainted before she explained, we will have to wait a couple days." Cindy's father replies.

"But, why?, we can take her to the hospital."

"We can't, they won't care about her situation, instead, they'll see a golden opportunity to test other experiments."

"Maybe they will pay some good money for her." Daniel proposes.

"Eat and stay quiet, young man." his mother orders.

"So, yeah, basically, until the professor gets out of the hospital and fixes the device, we can't do anything." Cindy responds.

"And, how are you sure that he won't try to do something else?" she asks.

"Because if that was their intention, I wouldn't be here, also, Janet said she will come here tomorrow to give us more information." the small girl says.

"Anyway, we need to protect her, and yes David, we are also counting you." David turns around, annoyed for carrying more responsibilities.
1113121.title: A new day as a fly.

choices: To the city, a fairy is coming.
11131211.content:
"And what's going to happen if you guys are already leaving?" Cindy asks, seeing her family ready to go.

"Fine, I'm taking you to school." David joyfully wants to take her, but, he is stopped by their parents.

"No, sorry, David, Cindy can't leave the house. This can be a good chance to see if she can deal with her situation." Her mother says.

"Eh, sure, I guess I can stay here until you get back." Cindy accepts.

"Great, then we'll see you later." she sees everyone leave and hears the door locking.

Completely alone, Cindy observes every room with her new size, "This didn't change so much, I thought I would see it like a city.". Bored and resting on the couch, she comes up with an idea, "I told them that I wouldn't leave, but, this is so boring. At least I could see our garden or go somewhere else." she says, "After all, only my family, Janet and the professor know about me, maybe I could tease some people outside." she giggles, "Our prank some kids, like a fairy or something like that."

Decided to do something besides waiting, Cindy crouches under the main door of her house and leaves too.
11131211.title: Everyody leaves and Cindy stays to check the ho...

112.content:
Stunned by the sudden changes to her body, Cindy stared in horror as Dr. Eomot's giant hand passed overhead. A tiny, high pitched squeal came out of her mouth as she tried to cover her nakedness.

"WHAT HAVE YOU DONE TO ME!!?"

Dr. Eomot leaned over the tiny fly girl as she cowered on the lab bench. Foremost in his mind was the impending lawsuit that would occur if he did not work quickly to contain the situation. Cindy was starting to back away across the lab bench, and he quickly moved his hand to block her path. From across the room came a tremendous crash as the giant fly bounded into a shelf full of glassware. "Cindy... just hop into the jar and I can fix everything, I promise."

Ignoring the shrieks of his assistant, he placed a specimen jar on the table and began sliding his hand forward to scoop the tiny girl in.

"NO WAY!" Cindy shrieked, "GET AWAY FROM ME!!"

Instinctively, the pair of wings on her back began to beat, lifting Cindy into the air. Too afraid to take in the chaos around her, Cindy began to dart frantically around the room, looking for a way out. Her entire body vibrated as the wings on her back beat rapidly. The buzzing sound filled her ears, drowining out the din of her surroundings.

Thinking only of escape, Cindy quickly darted through...
112.title: Escape!

1121.content:
Dr. Eomot stared helplessly as Cindy began flying in circles around the room. He caught a brief glimpse of her tiny body silhouetted against the ceiling lights heading for the air duct in the center of the room. "CINDY!" he yelled, but the tiny girl had already darted through the grating and disappeared.

A scream from his assistant shifted Dr. Eomot's focus. The giant fly had attempted to crawl around the technician in its search for an exit, and the hooks on its feet had stuck to her clothing. Desperate to avoid contact with the giant insect, his assistant squirmed and tried to pry the fly off, ripping her clothes in the process.

Dr. Eomot paused briefly, transfixed by the struggle between his beautiful, busty assistant and the hideous insect. By coincidence, they were near an experimental....
1121.title: Shifting Priorities

11212.content:
As Dr. Eomot watched his assistant, (whose name, incidentally, was Sandra), struggle to pry the giant fly off her body, he realized that they were standing in front of another of his prototype devices. Behind the pair stood his experimental stasis field generator, a machine capable of emitting a beam which, upon striking inorganic matter, would theoretically freeze it in time indefinitely. Although not fully completed, if he was able to generate enough power he might be able to create a beam powerful enough to freeze the fly.

As he stood, pondering this possibility, Sandra's foot came down hard on a power supply box at the base of the machine, sending sparks into the air. In the same moment, she wriggled free of her lab coat, exposing the pink tank top and jean shorts she was wearing underneath. Her tan cleavage bulged and her breasts jiggled as she swatted at the fly.

Dr. Eomot decided it was time to act. Waiting any longer would only result in more equipment getting destroyed. Wasting no time, he ran across the room and flipped the switch that would power up the machine. Seating himself at a computer a few meters from where his assistant and the fly were still struggling, he placed his hand over a mouse and clicked a button on the screen. A live view of Sandra and the fly appeared on the monitor in front of him. At the same moment, a dish shaped object extending out of the field generator swiveled to fix on the two creatures beneath it.

A red dot in the center of the screen indicated where the beam would strike. Moving the mouse, Dr. Eomot swiveled the dish on the field generator until it was targeted squarely on the fly's head. At this point, the insect had again clasped Sandra, it's forelegs pulling at her tank top. For her part, Sandra was pushing desperately against the fly, ripping the fabric of her tank top in the process. As Dr. Eomot pressed the button that would fire the beam, Sandra, in a final heave, tore free of her clothing, sending the fly and most of her pink tank top to the floor. The fly's head dropped out of range, and Sandra's magnificent breasts filled the display as the machine fired.

A green flash filled the room as the beam struck Sandra squarely in the chest. The fly, capitalizing on the incapacitation of his adversary, quickly scampered out of the room, dragging what remained of Sandra's tank top behind it.

Dr. Eomot peered out from the display at his now topless assistant. The stasis field....
11212.title: From Bad to Worse

112122.content:
The smell of ozone filled the air, and silence hung over the room. Sandra stood, beautiful and motionless, an expression of surprise frozen on her face. Feeling equal parts concern for his assistant and curiosity, Dr. Eomot rushed to examine Sandra's immobile form.

As he got up from the table, however, Dr. Eomot realized his stasis field generator had not done a thorough job of freezing Sandra in place. Barely perceptible at first, Sandra's eyes turned to follow the doctor's movement, then her head began to swivel. Her mouth, half open in surprise, parted slightly more as a long, low pitched sound escaped from her throat.

"Doooooctorrrrrr..."

Dr. Eomot's eyes widened as the truth dawned on him. Instead of freezing Sandra in time, the machine had sped up time around her! Now Sandra was trapped in a world in which objects and time flew by in an incomprehensible blur. Even now, he could see her breasts shifting in mid-bounce, her legs tensing and her body changing position slightly as she began to take a step forward.

Adding to the already enormous list of problems at hand, Sandra's remaining clothing, being affected differently by the machine, was moving at a different rate than she was. As she moved forward, her shorts and panties remained frozen in place and began to tear off her body. Walking around behind her, Dr. Eomot could already see a substantial portion of Sandra's rump already some distance separated from the rear of her shorts, which now hung motionless in space still conformed to the contours of her rear end.

As he watched, Sandra was beginning to show realization of her current situation. Her body was beginning to scrunch down as her arms slowly moved to cover her breasts. He surmised her mouth would be opening for an impending scream.

Running his hands through his hair, Dr. Eomot pondered his next move. Sandra would not go far, but he needed to find Cindy, as well as the fly, if he was to stand a chance of returning them both to normal.
112122.title: Sandra in Slow-Mo

1121222.content:
Meanwhile, tiny, naked Cindy buzzed frantically through the long, dark tunnels that were part of the school ventilation system. Seeing light up ahead, she zig-zagged towards it, dropping clumsily down onto the metal surface of the duct interior and walking the remaining distance to the opening.

Her hands instinctively covering her breasts, Cindy peered through the grating into the room below. A number of students were sitting at desks, apparently attending a biology lecture. As Cindy looked down at them, the reality of her situation began to sink in. Only fifteen minutes ago she had been a normal college co-ed. Now she was.... something else.

Her hands moved involuntarily to feel the wings on her back. Would she be stuck like this forever? As Cindy pondered this, she realized that if there was any chance of her returning to normal, it was through Dr. Eomot. Cursing herself for running away, Cindy turned and prepared to fly back the way she had come.

It was then that she realized she was lost. She had flown a great distance, and there were no landmarks inside the maze of dark tunnels that she could use to get back to the lab. At that moment, she heard the students below her pushing their chairs back as they left the class. Cindy considered her options. Should she risk flying down into the classroom, or try navigating back through the vents?
1121222.title: Now what?

choices: She doesn't make it (find another way)
11212222.content:
As much as she knew that the doctor was her only way of being fixed, she just didn't trust the old man, what with him wanting her in a jar for crying out loud! Buzzing down into the classroom, she flew around for a bit before finding a good spot to sit and rest up on one of the lights above the professor. Sitting there butt naked, Cindy tried to figure out what she could do now. It'd take forever for her to get home and contact someone's she could trust at this rate, and what if someone found her on her way there? She shuddered, there's no way she wants to be found by some creep.

The professor dismissed the class below and Cindy, in her haste, slipped while getting up to fly out with the students. Sliding down the top of the light, she smacked her hand she against it on.y to find that she'd stopped sliding. She looked at her hands curiously, it seems that she inherited the fly's ability to stick to surfaces!

Looking down at the class, she saw that the class was almost completely out of the room, buzzing her wings into action, Cindy flew for the doors with all her minuscule might, praying that she got there before they closed.
11212222.title: Fly down into the classroom

choices: She goes back to the lab, finding the slo-mo assistant
She leaves the building, intent on finding someone she trusts
112122221.content:
Now out in the hallway, Cindy looked around, her wings buzzing behind her as she quickly made a dash for her locker, she had some food in there and a spare set of clothes, she'd be safe and comfortable waiting out the massive crowds in the halls while she ate and slept on he balled up shirt.

Seeing a crowd around the lockers, she buzzed herself over to the wall and started climbing it up to the ceiling. "I feel like a superhero!" Cindy giggled to herself, climbing much like Spider-Man on the ceiling above the unaware students milking about in the hall. She sat there, fully exposed to anyone who'd look up, but because everyone was busy with finals coming up, everyone was looking down at their (or their friends) notes. Once she saw an opening to get to her locker, she took it.

Freefalling to her locker, she buzzed her wings as she reached the holes in her locker and climbed her way in, and immediately collapsed on her shirt, her heart racing and adrenaline coursing through her veins. But as she lay there, she was curious as to just how small she was, she wasn't as small as a fly thankfully, but she was small enough that if she was careful and quick, she wouldn't be noticed.

Opening up her notebook just enough to slide in, she could faintly see the ruler on the inside of the cover, measuring herself up against it, she found that she was only an inch and a half tall! Not even two inches!

"Is this going to be my life now?" She asked herself as she walked back to her shirt and sat there, hugging her knees to her bare chest, she quietly sobbed, not daring to make enough noise to be heard by any passersby in the hall.

Once she was done crying, she was able to open up her sandwich ziplock and took a tiny portion of the ham and bread to make an even smaller ham sandwich. "What am I going to do now?" She asked herself as she ate her tiny sandwich in her locker.
112122221.title: She makes it (in hallway now)

choices: Someone found her in the bush while she was sleeping
1121222212.content:
Cindy spent the next hour or so getting used to her new body, practicing with her flying and climbing on walls, in part to learn moreover about her body, but really it was to pass the time while she waited. Sitting on the shirt looking at one at her pocket mirrors, she still couldn't believe that's this was happening to her. She was a cheerleader, gorgeous red hair, beautiful face, her breasts are C-cup, but now all she saw was a naked winged freak, less than two inches tall. Her butt freckles (side effect of being a redhead) and crimson bush out for anyone to see, and there wasn't anything she could do about it..

"Time to go." She said to herself, climbing back out the hole and buzzing her way down the hall, looking for a way out. There! A group of students is heading out the main door!

Forcing herself to go faster to make it, she caught up to the group, hovering just behind them to make sure that nobody saw them. Hovering slowly and quietly behind them, she managed to get under one of their backpacks and grabbed onto the bottom of it, waiting for them to head out the doors. Once they were out, Cindy took off like a jet, heading off in the direction of her house, hopefully mom and dad were back from their vacation and could help her.

She had to fly carefully due to the greens being empty of trees, which meant a lot of open sky for a student to see her buzzing around. One close call with a particularly aggressive blue jay and two close calls involving a frisby and a football, she made it to the area around her neighborhood.

Buzzing carefully along, not wanting to attract any birds to her, she tiredly dropped into one of the bushes in the front yard of a house not too far from her neighborhood. Once she was sure that the interior of the bush was safe from spiders or other nasties, she climbed up a branches until she found a nook to rest in, and drifted off to take her nap.
1121222212.title: She leaves the building, intent on finding some...

11212222121.content: As Cindy slept, she realized that the branch she'd fallen asleep on wasn't hard anymore, now it was actually pretty comfortable. Opening her eyes, she found herself laying on a t-shirt folded up in a shoebox, which thankfully had the lid off. Looking around before flying out, she didn't really see anything that would tell he who had found her, or where she was, so she cautiously climbed the wall of the box, giving her wings a break, and when she peeked over the wall, she saw the room of a....
11212222121.title: Someone found her in the bush while she was sle...

choices: Cindy wakes up in the middle of the night and looks around the house
112122221211.content:
Looking around the room, Cindy saw the room of a little girl, from the decor, which was predominantly pink and Barbie themed, she assumed somewhere around 9-10. As she looked around the room, she felt the ground shake, ducking back in her box, she saw the door swing open and the girl was there, looking right at her.

The girl smiled and closed the door before approaching box and getting down in all fours to get a closer look. "Hi! I'm Lilly! What's your name miss fairy?"

Looking up at the girl, Cindy calmed herself before answering, "Cindy." She gestured around the room, "Why'd you bring me here?"

Lilly looked at her like she'd grown a second head, or the flys head if she was particularly unlucky, "I didn't want you to get hurt, so I brought you inside, I didn't want Nala to hurt you." As if sensing Cindys next question, she continued, "Nala is mommies cat."

Nodding mutely, Cindy climbed up and sat on the edge of the box, getting a good look around the room, Lilly just patiently watching her, waiting for her to do something. "Lilly, do you have any food?" Cindy asked, realizing that it had been quite some time since she last ate.

Lilly shot up and turned to leave the room, "I'll be right back. Don't leave!" And like that, she'd closed the door.

Buzzing her wings into action, Cindy flew around the room, getting a good look around and paused when she looked out the window. It was sunset, and she didn't want to be a victim to some bat she'd never be able to see coming, so it looked like she was stuck here for the night. Hearing the door swing open, Cindy flew up to the top of the window to hide behind the drapes, unsure if it was Lilly or her mother.

"Cindy?" She heard the little girl call out, "Where'd you go?" Buzzing back down from the window to land on Lilly's dresser, Cindy waved at the girl. "Oh, there you are." She placed some bread and an apple slice on a tissue, "This is all I could get without mommy seeing me."

Cindy landed and began to tear into the bread and apple, "Thank you!" She called out between bites.

And the two sat there in companionable silence until Cindy was done eating and Lilly threw out the remaining food in the trash. "Hey Cindy," Lilly asked nervously, wringing her hands together, "why're you naked?"

Looking down at her body, her trimmed red bush and C-cups out for anyone to see, she decided not to burden the girl with the truth and simply continue with the fairy story, "Nobody really makes clothes this small."

Lilly accepted this and pointed to a Barbie playhouse, "You can sleeping there, or in the box again, it's almost bedtime." Lilly started to pull out her PJ's and start getting changed.

Cindy nodded, "Hey Lilly," the girl what she was doing to look at Cindy, "don't tell your mommy about me, we're only supposed to be seen by kids ." Cindy hated lying to the girl about her real nature, but didn't want to break the girls innocence about what'd really happen to her if her mother found her.

Lilly nodded, and Cindy flew into the dollhouse and noticed that the bed had been padded up nicely with some clean socks, she could still faintly smell the soap on them. Bedding down, Cindy felt a little less nervous about the next day.
112122221211.title: Little girl

choices: Lilly wants to take Cindy with her to school
1121222212111.content:
Waking up sometime after the sun had gone down, Cindy was briefly confused about her whereabouts until she remembered that she had found shelter. Finding herself unable to fall back asleep, probably due to her nap earlier, she decided to buzz around the house and get a feel for the layout in case anything happened. First she had to get out of the dollhouse though.

Walking through the dollhouse was a little spooky, with the dolls laying or sitting about like manaquins, she frequently had to stop herself from having a heart attack once she entered a room and saw a silluette in the corner. Finding her way to the front door, Cindy buzzed her wings into action, flying to the door by way of nightlight, she landed and took a quick peek to make sure that's Lilly was still asleep before crawling under the door.

Once in the hall, Cindy felt even smaller than before, in either direction was a dark hall only illuminated by a nightlight coming from what she assumed was the bathroom...speaking of, Cindy decided to relieve herself before doing so somewhere embarrassing.

Once that was done with, she decided to simply take a look around the hall first, finding the moms room, and the guest bedroom easily enough, Cindy finished up with a quick flyby in the office before heading downstairs. The downstairs was darker than upstairs due to lack of light, but she could see well enough by moonlight to not bump into anything.

After getting a basic layout of the house she flew back up into Lilly's room and walked back into the dollhouse. "So, is this my future?" She thought to herself, "To wander aimlessly if there's no cure? Or to stay with Lilly and live in a dollhouse?"

Neither was particularly pleasing to think about, and in looking at the doll sized mirror in the wall, she took in her body, her curves, and her beautiful red curls...she'd never get a boyfriend, a future worth living if this was her permanent fate.

Deciding that her existential crisis could wait a bit longer, she crawled back into her bed and fitfully slept until morning.
1121222212111.title: Cindy wakes up in the middle of the night and l...

info.brief_description: A teleportation experiment goes slightly wrong...
info.description:
Cindy signs up for a science experiment involving a revolutionary teleportation device. However, a fly gets caught in the beam and there's a slight DNA mishap....

Nudity, most definitely. Sex of any kind, no. Feet, no. Toilet (shudder), no. Vore, no.
